elements.title: Kitty Marion
elements.contents: ... that Kitty Marion (pictured) was force-fed over 200 times during a hunger strike?

elements.title: North Korean destroyer Choe Hyon
elements.contents: ... that the North Korean destroyer Choe Hyon is the largest ship constructed for the Korean People's Navy?

elements.title: High and Low
elements.contents: ... that after the release of High and Low, director Akira Kurosawa received telephone calls imitating his film that threatened to kidnap his daughter?

elements.contents: ... that May Bradford Shockley is why Silicon Valley is where it is?

elements.title: Aquilegia paui
elements.contents: ... that the conservation of a goat might endanger the survival of Aquilegia paui?

elements.title: Joy Laking
elements.contents: ... that Joy Laking predicted in a school writing assignment that within ten years she would be making a living as an artist?

elements.title: Formosa Chang
elements.contents: ... that the Taiwanese restaurant chain Formosa Chang drew inspiration from McDonald's for its non-greasy atmosphere and corporate practices?

elements.title: Haridas Mitra
elements.contents: ... that Haridas Mitra had his death sentence commuted after the intervention of Mahatma Gandhi?

elements.title: Steve's Lava Chicken
elements.contents: ... that "Steve's Lava Chicken" recently became the shortest song to enter the UK Top 40?
